intro: Phyteuma orbiculare subsp. ibericum, commonly known as the Iberian phyteuma, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to southern Europe. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its rounded, often hairy leaves and showy, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to purple. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils in open habitats such as grasslands and scrublands. It is known for its adaptability to dry conditions and is often found in Mediterranean climates.
